de.esoco.gwt.client.ui

Class DataElementSwitchPanelManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerBuilder<C>
      • de.esoco.ewt.build.ContainerManager<C>
        • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.PanelManager<de.esoco.ewt.component.Container,PanelManager<?,?>>
          • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.DataElementPanelManager
            • de.esoco.gwt.client.ui.DataElementSwitchPanelManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.ewt.event.EwtEventHandler

    public class DataElementSwitchPanelManager
extends DataElementPanelManager
implements de.esoco.ewt.event.EwtEventHandler
    A panel manager for DataElementList instances that renders the child elements of the list in distinct visual groups (e.g. Tabs) that can be switched between.

    • Method Detail

      • addPageSelectionListener

        public void addPageSelectionListener(de.esoco.ewt.event.EwtEventHandler rListener)
        Adds an event listener for page selection events. The listener will be notified of an EventType.SELECTION event if a new layout page is selected. The source of the event will be the panel used by this panel manager, not the manager itself. Not all switching panels may support listener registrations.
        Parameters:
        rListener - The listener to notify if a new page is selected

      • collectInput

        public void collectInput(java.util.List<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> rModifiedElements)

        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • updateFromChildChanges

        public void updateFromChildChanges()
        Updates this list from properties of updated child data elements. This will be invoked after all children have been update and therefore replaced in the hierarchy. Can be overridden by subclasses that need to react to child updates if no re-build has been performed.
        Overrides:
        updateFromChildChanges in class DataElementPanelManager

      • updateUI

        public void updateUI()
        This method can be be overridden by subclasses to update the panel content from model data if it has changed. The default implementation invokes Component.repaint() on the manager's panel.

        Attention: Invoking this method will replace any values entered into input components with the model value stored in the data elements. Therefore it should only be invoked on display UIs or when the resetting of input fields is explicitly desired.

        Overrides:
        updateUI in class DataElementPanelManager
